page.title: 12WEST COKER AREA HOUSING
page.content: {THE OLDER HOUSES}IN THE VILLAGES DATE FROM THE 15TH CENTURY.THESE ARE BUILT OF HAMSTONE WHICH COMES FROM HAMHILL QUARRY 3 KILOMETRES AWAY,OR LOCAL STONE,WHICH IS A GOLDEN BROWN SAND STONE. THEY OFTEN HAVE HAMSTONE MULLION WINDOWS AND CARVED DRIP STONES OVER THE WINDOWS. A FEW COTTAGES RETAIN THE OLD SQUARE LEADED LIGHT WINDOWS.A NUMBER OF OF THESE ARE THATCHED. THERE IS A THATCHER IN CHINNOCK AND THATCHING IS NOW IN DEMAND AGAIN,MOST THATCH HOWEVER HAS BEEN REPLACED BY SINGLE OR DOUBLE ROMAN TILES. MANY OF THESE COTTAGE HAVE FEATURES SUCH AS INGLENOOK FIREPLACES AND LARGE CEILING BEAMS OF OAK OR ELM. MANY OF THESE COTTAGES ARE GRADE 2 LISTED BUILDINGS. THEIR PRICES VARY FROM Â£30,000 TO Â£70,000.
